steps: They are electrical wires with connector pins at each end.
They are used to connect two points in a circuit without soldering.
Let us now look at the types.
The male to male jumper wire is the most commonly used jumper wire.
They are used to connect two points in a circuit or two ports on breadboard.
They also interconnect components placed on breadboard to other points of the circuit.
The female to female jumper wire has different connector pin at its ends
They are used to connect to female socket pins in prototyping boards.
These type is male to female jumper wire which is a combination of the first two types
They are used to connect two points in a circuit with one point being a female socket.
The breadboarding jumper wires have no connector pins at its end
They are used to interconnect components on the breadboard.
Mostly used in connections between point or components that are closer together.
